Gotta love Xayah.... The immature little child on a ill-advised racist crusade against all humans enabled by a vapid yes-man with no spine. Her story is a prime example of the type of character that makes me want to wring their neck 5 min into any movie.

Did you not read her stuff??
Let's recap. Through her life Xayah was told stories of how great her kind once was. Around her she sees humans moving in and her people losing more and more. No she eventually goes against orders and heads to human villages to TALK TO THEM. Not kill, just talk. What happens? They either assault her and take things, or she defends herself and kills them. Not a very good impression of humans being built here.
She gets home only to find her people are gone and shadow magic corrupted a nearby temple. She cleanses it but can still find no trace of her loved ones. She is now very alone in the world.
Now she is traveling the land to find answers, having to defend herself with stealth and killing everywhere she goes. As she travels her view of humans isn't exactly helped and she sees little but mistreatment of her kind and thus she slowly becomes the character we see today.

Then we have Rakan, a flamboyant performer who loves attention, dance, and song. He wants to hear the songs of the world and wants the world to hear all of his. One day in a mountain village the 2 cross paths while Rakan is putting on one of his shows. Everyone has fallen under Rakan's spell, except for Xayah. This intrigues him and he follows her, helping her out of an ambush. They spend time together and over time and adventures they grow to truly love each other and have each other's backs. Xayah wants to free her people, not kill all humans in a racist crusade. If killing needs to happen, then it will happen. Rakan is not a spineless yes-man. Rakan is Xayah's emotional support while she in turn gives him focus and purpose in life. If Rakan didn't have Xayah then he would be wandering to this day with no rhyme or reason until he eventually died. If Xayah didn't have Rakan then she would be dead or worse by now. She would not be able to pull of stuff like that prison break, not to mention she would probably fall to the lingering emotional stress she clearly has as shown by the end of their color stories.

I mean, I like Rakan's personality. It's fun, goofy, and yet serious when necessary. He has a lot of depth off hte stage, in my opinion.

On hte topic of him being "narrow minded", think of it this way: you've spent your entire life being told one thing. It might be that god exists, it might be that pluto's a planet, whatever it is. You spend your entire life finding people who agree with you on that that when you eventually find an atheist or someone from a religion that doesn't focus around your god, or people decide that pluto's not a planet, it's going to be confusing. You'll want to figure more out about it. He actually tried to figure out what was going on because people only seemed to be interested in him before (he seems to pick her out not for looks and not noticing him, but just for not being interested), so finding someone who didn't just love him at first sight was new. He wanted to learn more about it. It's sort of like that.
